billEvents.eventText: REFERRED TO HOUSING, CONSTRUCTION AND COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT

title: Expands the definition of "tenant" for purposes of notice upon the commencement of an action to foreclose upon the leased residential real property
summary: Expands the definition of "tenant" for purposes of notice upon the commencement of an action to foreclose upon the leased residential real property.
lawSection: Real Property Actions and Proceedings Law
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         1520

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                   I N  S E N A T E

                                   January 10, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  Sen.  KLEIN  -- read twice and ordered printed, and when
         printed to be committed to the Committee on Housing, Construction  and
         Community Development

       AN  ACT  to  amend  the  real  property  actions and proceedings law, in
         relation to notice to tenants upon foreclosure of the leased  residen-
         tial real property

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Paragraph (c) of subdivision 1 of section 1305 of the  real
    2  property  actions  and  proceedings  law, as added by chapter 507 of the
    3  laws of 2009, is amended to read as follows:
    4    (c) "Tenant" shall mean  any  person  who  [at  the  time  the  notice
    5  required  by  subdivision four of section thirteen hundred three of this
    6  article] appears as a lessee on a lease of one or more dwelling units of
    7  a residential real property that is subordinate to the mortgage on  such
    8  residential  real  property; or who [at such time] is a party to an oral
    9  or implied rental agreement with the mortgagor and obligated to pay rent
   10  to the mortgagor or such mortgagor's  representative,  for  the  use  or
   11  occupancy of one or more dwelling units of a residential real property.
   12    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.




        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD05020-01-1
